name: Desulfovibrio hydrothermalis AM13
description: Desulfovibrio hydrothermalis AM13T is a mesophilic; hydrogenotrophic; sulfate-reducing bacterium isolated from a deep-sea hydrothermal chimney sample collected at 13¬ø¬ø N on the East-Pacific Rise at a depth of 2600 m. D. hydrothermalis is piezophilic; having an optimal growth at 25 MPa. Here we report the complete genome sequence of strain AM13; the type strain of D. hydrothermalis. The genome sequence is 3;702;934 bp lengh; with a G+C content of 45;14%. Moreover; the genome includes a circular plasmid of 5;328 bp. The genome reveals a view of the adaptation strategy to life in the depth in Desulfovibrio.
